titleStmt.title: Magneto-vibrational anomalies in NpO 2 Experiment number: HC2505

analytic.title: Magneto-vibrational anomalies in NpO 2 Experiment number: HC2505

div.p: Names and affiliations of applicants (* indicates experimentalists): *L. Paolasini (ESRF) *R. Caciuffo (ITU, Karlsruhe)? *N. Magnani (ITU, Karlsruhe)? *G. H. Lander (ITU, Karlsruhe)
I do not know if anyone else was here, and my presence was "fleeting" as I left on 4/6.

The present experiment was a re-examination of the low-energy acoustic phonons to determine whether there was any sign of the predicted mixing of these phonons (thus giving rise to anomalies in the intensities across the BZ) with the excitations from the quadrupolar moments known to exist in NpO 2 below 25 K [see P. Santini et al., Rev. Mod. Phys. 81, 807 (2009)]. A quick look at these modes at low temperature was made during the earlier NpO 2 experiment and some possible anomalies were observed.

On careful examination of the acoustic modes at low temperature in the present experiment no observable effects were found. The earlier effects were ascribed to sample movement during rotation in the beam.

More recently, we have been able to detect signs of the quadrupole acoustic waves, but in UO 2 . Once these are measured and understood with X-rays, it is possible we shall want to return to the interesting case of NpO 2 .
